definition: four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
four/4
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: His feet stuck up in the air.
The woman, sprawled on the ground, was seen wailing.
sentences.chinese: 這名女乘客四腳朝天地躺在地上，並在地上打滾哭鬧。

sentences.english: The horse will slip up bad in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 那隻馬在草叢裏，將跌個四腳朝天。

sentences.english: A man came and slammed the turtle out fall.
sentences.chinese: 一個漢子走過來，用力把海龜翻個四腳朝天。

sentences.english: He tried to jump high like the others, but he always fell.
sentences.chinese: 他想要跟別人一樣跳很高，卻總是摔得四腳朝天。

sentences.english: Luckily it didn't hurt his arms and brains but fell on his head.
sentences.chinese: 四腳朝天摔得巧，沒傷胳膊沒傷腦。

sentences.english: Sometimes, he twists his body like this and rolling on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 有時，也會出現這種扭曲身體四腳朝天的睡姿。

sentences.english: My foe outstretched beneath the tree.
sentences.chinese: 我的敵人四腳朝天樹下躺。

sentences.english: Finally she is pushed to the ground and falls on her back.
sentences.chinese: 最後更被重重一推，四腳朝天摔在地上。

definition: exactly what one wants
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to crush
to boast
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
blocking the way
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
female gossip/busybody
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
ability/skill
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
foolish talk/nonsense
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
